thread.title: Ex-Bulldog Faulk Will Be 'Canes Alt. Captain
thread.title_full: Ex-Bulldog Faulk Will Be 'Canes Alt. Captain

title: Ex-Bulldog Faulk Will Be 'Canes Alt. Captain
text:
Ex-Bulldog Faulk Will Be 'Canes Alt. Captain 
By Zach Schneider Ex-Bulldog Faulk Will Be 'Canes Alt. Captain October 7, 2015 Updated Oct 7, 2015 at 12:57 PM CDT 
Raleigh, NC (NNCNOW.com) --- Former University of Minnesota Duluth (UMD) defenseman Justin Faulk will serve as an alternate captain this season for the NHL's Carolina Hurricanes, the team announced on Wednesday. 
"Justin has emerged as an All-Star player in this league and a leader in our dressing room,” head coach Bill Peters said in a statement. “His leadership is on display every day in his commitment to his teammates and carries through to his dedication to the organization and our community.” 
Click here to subscribe to our daily newsletter. 
Faulk finished last season with career with career highs in every offensive category, totaling 15 goals, 34 assists, and 49 total points for the Hurricanes. 
For those efforts, he was named last season to his first-ever NHL All-Star Game, an event in which he collected two assists. 
Faulk played just one season for UMD, finishing with eight goals and 25 assists while helping the Bulldogs win the 2011 NCAA Division I championship.
